Fields.DialogueText: Bolzano?
Bolzano!
Where did she run off to?
Capitano, I heard you calling for Bolzano. Is everything all right?
I have to speak with her, but it seems finding her is never easy.
You might want to try the lower hold, Capitano.
Are you aware of her location, officer?
Not in the slightest. My inclination would suggest the cargo hold where she stores her bicycle. You know, she calls it Nicolina.
Nicolina... you're joking, right?
*ALARM*
Forget it. We have company. Prepare for combat!
Right away.
Capitano! I'm here.
Someone told me you were calling for me.

Fields.MenuText: So nice of you to join us. Now where the hell did you run off to?
As captain of this vessel I need you present when I demand it, understood?
This is not a great start to our working relationship.

Fields.DialogueText: I was fixing something.
Understood.
I am sorry you feel that way.
So, what did you need?
It doesn't matter now. Time to fight.
@BATTLE
Enjoying the view, Bolzano?
Bolzano?
Huh?
I said... never mind. I came to apologize for our previous conversation.
There is no need, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: The crew's safety is a heavy burden to carry, one I take seriously.
Our communication needs to improve if we are to stand a chance against the Morganas.
The serenity of the water is calming. One can better reflect when the mind is at ease.

Fields.DialogueText: That is your duty.
I understand, Capitano.
It is indeed very beautiful...
Anyway, I just wanted to check in. I'll leave you to it.
*ALARM*
Here we go.
@BATTLE
It's a mess.
Pardon?
The ship. It's a mess.
The result of hard-fought battles.
Sì, but Ispettrice Fiorenza will not be happy if she sees this.
Who?
Ispettrice Fiorenza. She is being sent from the Regia Marina to do a review of every Italian ship in the fleet.
Interesting.
Don't tell me this is the first time you are hearing of this.

Fields.MenuText: It doesn't sound familiar.
Of course I heard. I was just having a laugh.
The last thing I need is someone telling me how to run my own ship.

Fields.DialogueText: It should.
You are a good leader, but not the best liar.
If you're going to command an Italian ship, you ought to respect the customs of the Regia Marina.
All right, all right. Tell me who she is.
Fiorenza is the new replacement ispettrice - the inspector. People have said she's exceptionally demanding. She is reviewing the ships to report back to the Regia Marina.
What happened to the old inspector?
I'm afraid that is beyond my knowledge, Capitano.
*ALARM*
Come on, Capitano! We have more Morganas to see to.
How are you so fast?
@BATTLE
Capitano. Our repair efforts have been increasing as of late.
The seas haven't been kind to us, Officer Amadeo.
I have a solution to propose. One that--
Look out!
Watch where you're going! Why do you insist on riding that bicycle on the deck?
Her name is Nicolina, Officer Amadeo.

Fields.MenuText: You could have hurt Amadeo.
Relax, Amadeo, it's just a harmless bicycle.
We're in the middle of a war and you're riding a bicy- I mean, Nicolina?

Fields.DialogueText: And I do apologize for that. I suppose I should be more attentive to my speed when the crew's around.
Her name is Nicolina.
Just because we're at war doesn't mean I can't enjoy myself during my free time.
I will never understand your fascination with that stupid bicycle.
Well, there's certainly no need for that sort of attitude.
What were you about to suggest?
My suggestion, Capitano, was to reinforce the ship's armor plating. Increase the defense.
At the expense of our speed?
Speed means nothing if we're at the bottom of the ocean.
*ALARM*
Hold that thought.
Glory until death.
@BATTLE
Bolzano, you've been in the cargo hold for hours. The next meal is nearly ready.
I'll be there in a moment, Capitano. I promise.
I'm putting the finishing touch on these weapon upgrades for Nicolina.

Fields.MenuText: Nicolina looks like she could end the war on her own.
More Alpine cheese and speck for me.
I worry about your relationship with that bicycle.

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt that, but Nicolina certainly appreciates the sentiment.
Aww... cheese and speck are my favorites. I can't stop now, though.
You should have far more pressing worries on your mind than my love for Nicolina, Capitano.
All right, I'll leave you to it.
Capitano...
What is it?
I sense danger looming.
Morganas?
Sì, heading straight in our direction.
You've never mentioned sensing the Morganas before.
If I'm focused on other subjects, it can be difficult to notice their presence.
We might need to have a conversation about your priorities, Bolzano.
... After the battle?
Well, yes.
@BATTLE
Capitano. We received news from the Regia Marina.
Go on.
It's about the ispettrice's visit, Capitano.
I'm listening.
Apparently, she is inspecting the Italian fleet to determine who is most fit to carry out a top-secret mission.

Fields.MenuText: There's no competition. We're in peak condition.
Top secret? Sounds very suspicious. Keep your wits about you.
Another distraction from the real mission.

Fields.DialogueText: Arrogance is the best way to end up in second place.
My wits are always about me, Capitano.
This is an honor not to be taken lightly.
I suppose we will see.
Sorry to interrupt. Morganas are approaching.
A fine time for a scrimmage.
I heard about the nature of the Ispettrice's visit. Do you really think we have a chance to win the Regia Marina's favor?
Perhaps, but now is not the time for such a discussion. Let's go.
Yes, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Don't be silly. My ship is second to none when it comes to speed.
But without properly reinforced armor, we may as well be in a lifeboat.
I must disagree.
Capitano, tell Bolzano the importance of strong defense.
Capitano, I understand the importance of defense - but I'm confident that speed will always win the day.

Fields.MenuText: Bolzano is faster than the wind, and I intend to keep her that way.
With so many Morganas on the water, a little more protection couldn't hurt.
Neither. Offense comes first. More guns, more guns.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew you would understand, Capitano.
I'm sorry, but I refuse to turn this vessel into a floating tank.
You just love to blow things up, don't you?
It is up to the ispettrice to decide, I suppose.
*ALARM*
Here we go again.
Seems as if a combination of speed, offense and defense might serve us well right about now, right?
I stand by my opinion.
Me, too.
Sigh...
@BATTLE
Amadeo, can I have a word?
Capitano?
I noticed you and Bolzano haven't seen eye to eye lately.
We have our differences.
Reassure me that the integrity of this crew isn't in jeopardy because of pointless grudges.
You need not worry, Capitano.
Good.
The problem with Bolzano is that she acts fast and reckless with no regard for strategy. It's a dangerous mentality to have in a war of patience.
The crew calls her tactics "un errore splendidamente riuscito" - an error beautifully executed.

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps the tides of war are changing and demand such an approach?
I take your battle expertise seriously, Amadeo.
Stop this pointless squabble immediately.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps I'm just old. I do know, however, how battles are won.
Thank you, Capitano.
I will try and refrain from further squabbles, Capitano.
From here on in, focus on the task at hand. Keep these waters safe.
*ALARM*
Speaking of which...
@BATTLE
Capitano!
Ah. You trying to give me a heart attack?
Hee! Sorry, I didn't meant to.
What is it?
The state review should be happening any time now. I have the crew running drills on the deck to prepare.
Perfect. The ship looks tidy too. I don't see anything that could go wrong.
Listen... I want to apologize.
What for?
You see, Nicolina means everything to me. We have big plans together, so when others threaten those plans, sometimes my temper flares.
But I recognize that I should have better control over my temper, especially if we're to stand a chance against the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you. I must say, though, I do admire your passion.
I do need you to control your temper. Distractions can put us all in danger.
Nicolina is definitely the better half of that relationship.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I'm... happy to hear that, Capitano.
I will do my best.
Oh, Capitano, you're always making such interesting jokes.
I need you to get along with Officer Amadeo, especially in preparation for Ispettrice Fiorenza's arrival.
Capitano...
I mean it, Bolzano.
It's not that. I sense Morganas on the way.
Oh, right.
@BATTLE
Capitano!
Capitano?
What are you so wound up for?
Apologies, but Ispettrice Fiorenza has arrived. Today is the day.
Bring her aboard. Let's not delay this introduction any longer than we have to.
I shouldn't be this excited, but I am.
Let's get this over with...

Fields.MenuText: Ispettrice, it's a pleasure to meet you.
Get on with it and wrap this up quickly.
I'm sorry, Ispettrice. It's just that... you're stunning.

Fields.DialogueText: Hello, Capitano.
That attitude is not improving your chances, Capitano.
I am going to pretend you never said that line, but if your Belle has any complaints I will make sure you end up mopping docks in Sicily, far away from any female sailor.
I am Ispettrice Fiorenza, and I come on behalf of the Regia Marina.
I've heard many good things about Bolzano. Still, I will not hold back any criticisms I have. I expect only the best from the Italian ships in the fleet.
I'd expect nothing less.
H-hey, sorry to interrupt...
Can it wait?
No, I sense danger. Incoming Morganas.
Great timing.
Good. Let us see what you can do. I'll be watching, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Ispettrice.
Capitano.
I had a chance to see your combat tactics first hand. They were good for a yawn or two.

Fields.MenuText: We're still breathing, though, aren't we?
How dare you insult my naval strategies!
You need to get your eyes checked, lady. They didn't stand a chance against us.

Fields.DialogueText: The bare minimum won't suffice, in this case.
That is precisely why I am here, Capitano.
My eyes are fine. Your tactics, on the other hand, are not.
My priority is the safety of the crew. I'm not looking to put on a show.
A shame. Perhaps Capitano Lorenzo has already won.
Lorenzo?
Capitano Lorenzo, a battle-hardened leader. Top in the fleet and top of my list. His stature commands respect from each crew member that stands before him.
Sounds as if my review is pointless, then.
Don't be so quick to give up. This ship's speed does give it certain... advantages.
So, then, what's next?
I will stay and continue my review. Go about your business as if I am not even here. Good day, Capitano.
Easier said than done...
Capitano, an attack is coming!
@BATTLE
Hey, I have some good news.
The Ispettrice fell overboard?
Capitano!
The upgrades on Nicolina are complete. It took me a while to perfect this blueprint, but she's ready for action.
Why exactly are you upgrading her?
To one day compete in the Tour De France.
And the armaments?
Well, we are still at war, Capitano. Destroying the Morganas is still my priority.

Fields.MenuText: I have no doubts that one day you and Nicolina will race the Tour De France.
Nicolina means the world to you, so I support your dreams.
Can I take it for a spin?

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Do you truly believe so?
Grazie! It makes me happy to know that.
If you can handle her.
Of course.
*ALARM*
Capitano. This battle will be a challenge.
But no match for the speed of Bolzano.
@BATTLE
Great work, everyone! Those Morganas ought to think twice before challenging us again.
Expecting more company?
Nothing we can't handle.
*BOOM*
W-what was that?
Ooof! ... It came from inside the ship...
Capitano, we're under attack! Please hurry!
@BATTLE
That's the last of them.
Good God... look at this place.
Nobody was hurt, though. We had that much luck, at least!
Capitano. The entire cargo hull has been damaged. Is everyone safe?
To my knowledge, yes. What caused this?
Look at those fragments...
It appears to be some sort of homemade explosive.
The Morganas weren't responsible for this. That can only mean someone on board was responsible.
Capitano, how much confidence do you have in your crew?

Fields.MenuText: I would die for them.
The crew have sworn their loyalty to the Protection Force. I trust them with my life.
You have some nerve, accusing my crew.

Fields.DialogueText: It appears there is someone who would rather you did.
Well, this explosive wasn't put here on its own.
You may not wish to believe it, but do not be naive, Capitano.
No. Please, no. No, no, no...
It's only cargo. Everything can be replaced.
Nicolina was beside the bomb. She's gone. Destroyed.
Your bike? I'm so sorry, Bolzano...
Who's responsible for this? I'll stop at nothing to find them!
Look, over there, near the source of the blast.
What is it?
It appears to be a pin. The same pin that an officer would wear...
Capitano, any idea who this might belong to?
None yet.
There's only one way to find out.
What do you suggest?
Find out which officer has a missing pin.
Right. Gather the officers in the quarters for a surprise inspection. But tell Officer Amadeo to report here. I’ve got a feeling he may know something.
On it! We'll catch this traitorous scum.
I will not count this hiccup against your score, but you must understand that this ship is not in any condition for a special operation.
My only concern right now is getting to the bottom of this.
Capitano, make no mistake that I am working tirelessly to find the saboteur behind this.
I believe you, Amadeo.
Officer... might I inquire about your uniform?
Of course.
I noticed you have one fewer pin than normal.
Oh, I haven't noticed. I-I must have misplaced it.
Amadeo...
Does this belong to you, officer? It was found at the scene of the blast.
W-wait, this is the first I am hearing of this. You can't possibly believe I had something to do with this.

Fields.MenuText: This entire situation seems fishy.
How could you, Amadeo?
It can't be true. It just can't be.

Fields.DialogueText: You believe me, don't you, Capitano?
This proves nothing!
Please, after all we've been through. You know me better than this, Capitano.
Have this traitor taken to the brig.
*ALARM*
Damn, not now.
I'll keep a close eye on Officer Amadeo during the battle.
@BATTLE
Amadeo. How could you do this?
You have to believe me, Capitano. I would never jeopardize Bolzano or anyone aboard the ship.
It's not as if you've been my biggest supporter all this time.
I know you two haven't been the best of friends, but we can't be rash in figuring out what happened here.
All evidence seems to point to Amadeo being a traitor.
What reason would I have? I've loyally served the Regia Marina for decades.
You never liked Nicolina. Maybe you meant to take her out, but the explosion was a little larger than you expected.
There are far less dangerous methods of disposing of a bicycle, you have to admit.
Do not let the friendship you have with Amadeo blind you, Capitano.
The person who did this is still at large!
Amadeo has been passionate about upgrading the ship's armor plating. Planting a bomb is the best way to prove his point.
This is ridiculous. Capitano, what do you believe?

Fields.MenuText: This situation doesn't look good for you.
I can't believe you would ever do this.
I don't know what to believe anymore.

Fields.DialogueText: But, Capitano...
Thank you. I knew you wouldn't.
Believe me, Capitano.
*ALARM*
Enough. We have more pressing matters to attend to.
I'm sorry, Amadeo...
The truth will come to light.
I know you regard Amadeo as a friend, Capitano, but the evidence...
@BATTLE
Bolzano...
Listen, I am sorry for what happened to Nicolina.
I worked on her for so long. Look at this blueprint.
So why not build another one?
It took me so long, and fixing bicycles the way I do demands skill. I don't know that I have it in me to do it again.

Fields.MenuText: The war has taken from all of us.
I'll stop at nothing to get to the bottom of this.
Sitting around weeping isn't helping you, is it?

Fields.DialogueText: Amadeo will answer for this.
You mean we, Capitano.
Your bedside manner isn't the best, Capitano.
I'm going to talk to Amadeo. Something doesn't feel right about this.
Remember, if he could betray us, then he could very well lie, too.
*ALARM*
Here, take the blueprint back.
Keep it or throw it away. My focus will be on the war now, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Capitano. I'm so glad to see you.
Amadeo, I need you to be honest with me.
I didn't do it, Capitano. I serve you with honor and pride.
Then who could it be?
This ispettrice... she is very suspicious. The explosion happened so soon after her arrival.

Fields.MenuText: It's just a coincidence. I doubt an agent of the state, a decorated war hero, would betray her country just like that.
That struck me as odd, too.
Maybe there was a reason she and I never saw eye to eye.

Fields.DialogueText: Everyone has a price, Capitano.
She's behind this! I can feel it.
I always knew you were bright, Capitano.
Did you know... Fiorenza carries a photo of Capitano Lorenzo with her. The one favored to win the secret mission. I saw her staring at it with... a strange look.
What sort of look?
I saw the passion in her eyes. They must be linked somehow...
*ALARM*
I'll think of something, friend.
@BATTLE
Capitano.
This has been an interesting review, indeed.
To say the least.
I will be leaving soon, I've seen nearly enough.
Ispettrice, aside from everything that happened, I do hope you enjoyed your stay.
Enjoyed my stay? Hah. I can't wait to leave.
You know...
Yes?
I noticed you carry a picture of Capitano Lorenzo. Any particular reason?
Have you been spying on me? It's none of your business what I keep with me!
Sorry, I didn't mean to strike a nerve.
He is somewhat... dashing.
He lights up the seas as he charges into battle! Capitano Lorenzo is what the Regia Marina needs!

Fields.MenuText: I see...
I was starting to think you didn't like anything, Ispettrice.
The sea lights up when I charge into battle, too. I'm sure of it.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, I got distracted there.
He is just an impressive capitano, that's all.
You think so highly of yourself.
Hate to break this up, but I feel Morganas coming our way.
Watch me light up the sea, Ispettrice.
@BATTLE
Bolzano, we need to talk.
Sì, Capitano?
I think Amadeo is innocent. The one responsible is Fiorenza.
Even if that were true, you can't go around accusing an official. What proof do you have?
Think about it. She arrives, and soon afterward we're hit with an explosion. Plus she's obsessed with that picture of Lorenzo.
Your conclusion?

Fields.MenuText: Fiorenza sabotaged the ship in order to give him the upper hand, for love.
Lorenzo and Fiorenza are in cahoots.
Fiorenza is a creepy stalker, and Lorenzo has no idea.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose love can blind anyone.
It is strange, but possible, I guess...
You know how crazy that sounds?
But how do we prove it?
I'm going to distract her while you leave a recording device in Fiorenza's room. I'll persuade her to stay longer. Maybe we can get a confession.
It's worth a try.
*ALARM*
Thanks for sticking with me, Bolzano. Let's get to work.
@BATTLE
So, any idea how to pull this off without drawing suspicion?
I have my methods.
If she is responsible for the bomb, the truth will come out. I may have my differences with Amadeo, but I don't want him punished for a crime he didn't commit.
When Fiorenza arrives, I'll make my way and plant this recording device in her room.
Capitano.
Speak of the devil.
You wanted to speak with me?
Ahem. Bolzano, excuse us. This is a private matter.
Hmph. I can take a hint.
My time is precious. Hurry it up.
The repairs on the hull finished ahead of schedule. The crew has been working around the clock.
That was much faster than expected...

Fields.MenuText: I thought you would be a little more excited to hear that.
Much faster, which is why Lorenzo is no match for us.
Despite being sabotaged, we have proven our ability to bounce back.

Fields.DialogueText: This mess shouldn't have happened under your watch in the first place.
Ha! You finally made me laugh, Capitano.
Be that as it may, I've made my decision already.
Stay a little longer and let me prove that I'm better than Lorenzo. You owe me that much.
Do I? Very well, I'll grant you more time. I can't say that it will have much effect on my final decision, though.
*ALARM*
You won't regret it.
I'd better not. I'll take my leave of you now, Capitano.
Psst! Bolzano... did you plant the recording device?
Sì! Now we wait...
Now we fight.
@BATTLE
Morganas are headed this way! Get ready!
@BATTLE
That's the last of them.
Good. Any word regarding Fiorenza?
Nothing new, but she does talk to herself.
Talks to herself? What does she say?
A lot of nonsense. It's pretty funny, actually. She was really into a piece of Alpine cheese she stole from the mess.
If only stealing cheese was enough to incriminate.
Ha! Well, she's capable of dishonesty, at least.
Capitano...
Yes, Bolzano?
I feel as if these recent events have brought us closer together. At least, I think they have. Don't you?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, I value our friendship.
I do... my feelings for you grow stronger everyday.
Don't get all sappy on me.

Fields.DialogueText: Friends... yes, we are good friends.
Really? I'm happy we are on the same page, Capitano.
I'm just letting you know how I feel.
When this war is over, I think we all deserve to unwind. What do you plan to do?
I'd like to visit my namesake city. Cycling around the Italian countryside seems as idyllic an experience as one could fathom.
Sounds nice...
Do you cycle, Capitano?
Not as well as you, I'm sure.
Ah, well. Nicolina would have loved to see the Italian Alps.
About Nicolina...
Sì?
... Never mind. For now.
How are you holding up?
It's cramped in here. The rats are keeping me company, though.
I am sorry... I'm doing everything I can to clear your name.
I don't doubt it for one second, Capitano.
Guys! You won't believe this.
What is it?
Fiorenza. The traitorous devil. Listen to this recording.
My dear Lorenzo... sweet, magnificent and mighty. I can't wait to leave this damned ship so I can once again gaze into your eyes.
So, there is something between her and Lorenzo. How does this help?
Shh! Keep listening...
The bomb wasn't enough to slow the ship. Such a powerful ship... how do I disable it without drawing more attention? Think, Fiorenza, think...
This proves she is behind all of this. She framed you, Amadeo.
Oh, thank the heavens. What do we do next, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Confront Fiorenza. Have her admit to her crimes.
Throw her off the boat, and she can swim to her love.
Tell her she's a meanie?

Fields.DialogueText: The most obvious play, Capitano.
That would make you no better than her, I feel.
I doubt her feelings can be hurt with such insults, Capitano.
Amadeo... I'm sorry for accusing you. I should have listened to you.
It's all right, Bolzano. The evidence pointed at me. And it's not as if I had given you much reason to trust me.
You cleared my name... now, I'm indebted to you.
It's the least I could do.
*ALARM*
First we handle the Morganas. Then we handle Fiorenza.
@BATTLE
These constant battles are becoming a nuisance.
Cut the act, Fiorenza.
I beg your pardon? Do not speak to me in that tone.
You are behind everything. The explosion in the hull, the appearance of Amadeo's pin...
Don't forget Nicolina.
That's a bold claim, one which could bring you trouble if you have no evidence.
Funny you would mention that...
The bomb wasn't enough to slow the Bolzano. Such a powerful ship... how do I disable it without drawing more attention? Think, Fiorenza, think...
Where did you get that? You were recording me?!

Fields.MenuText: It's over, Fiorenza. You betrayed the Regia Marina.
We have the evidence. I'm sure the Regia Marina will find it very interesting.
We have everything, including the Alpine cheese you stole.

Fields.DialogueText: They will believe me over you.
How dare you invade my privacy.
I really don't think that cheese should be your top concern, at the moment.
Bolzano, send word to the Regia Marina. Let them know their ispettrice is a traitor to the fleet.
With pleasure.
Why is Amadeo out of his cell?
Because you're going in. For betraying me, you will spend the rest of your days aboard this ship in the brig.
B-but you can't!
That means no more Lorenzo.
Not my sweet Lorenzo! You can't separate us forever. I love him and he will soon love me. He must know my true feelings!
Amadeo, have her escorted to the brig. The Regia Marina will collect her and do with her as they see fit.
Yes, Capitano.
I will not be stopped!
What a mess... Ugh, and speaking of...
@BATTLE
Capitano, I received word from the Regia Marina.
What did they say?
They were shocked at the news of Fiorenza and want her sent back immediately. She faces serious jail time for this.
As she should.
That's not all, Capitano.
Go on.
In light of the sabotage, your ability to bounce back, and uncovering Fiorenza's plot, they have decided to award you the special mission.
That's great news. Out of curiosity, what is the mission?
It's an escort mission. We will be transporting a certain VIP.
What an honor, I suppose. Out of all the ships in the fleet, they chose us.
So you accept, then?

Fields.MenuText: How could I say no?
It's too dangerous on these waters...
Nope, too tired.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit, Capitano.
Bolzano can manage any danger, Capitano.
I know you're joking, Capitano.
All right, send word to the Regia Marina that we accept. Oh, and there's one more thing...
What is it?
Fiorenza stripped you of your badge and title. I think it is fair to say you've earned it back, officer.
I... don't know what to say.
*ALARM*
You don't have to say a thing.
I missed this... and now, to battle!
After the battle, tell Bolzano to meet me in the cargo hull.
Yes, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Morganas are headed this way! Get ready!
@BATTLE
Capitano, you wanted me to meet you here?
Yes, I have something for you.
If it is Alpine cheese and speck, I already stuffed my face earlier.
Well, I kept your blueprint. It was a complicated one, for sure, but nothing our mechanics couldn't handle in their down time. In fact, I think they enjoyed themselves.
I don't understand...
Say hello to Nicolina II.
Nicolina... II? She... she looks exactly the same. How did you... why did you?
I knew how much she meant to you, and I missed your happy energy when you were around her.
No one has ever done anything like this for me before! Grazie, Capitano. Thank you so much.
You were instrumental in uncovering Fiorenza. As such, we won the special mission. You've earned it.
Capitano...

Fields.MenuText: Your friendship really is valuable to me, Bolzano. I'm so happy we get to serve together.
You're an incredible Belle, Bolzano.

Fields.DialogueText: Me, too! Those Morganas won't stand a chance against us.
Capitano... you're going to make me blush.
